summary: This is a court filing titled 'Plaintiff's Notice of Serving Third Amended Answers to Defendant's First Interrogatories' from a civil case (08-CV-80811) in the Southern District of Florida. The document is a notice that amended interrogatory answers have been provided to the defendant's attorney, and it includes excerpts of the interrogatories posed to the plaintiff, which ask for detailed personal, employment, and sexual history.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the civil case (Case No.: 08-CV-80811). The interrogatories are propounded by him, and questions specifically ask about sexual activity excluding him.

events.title: Defendant Serves First Interrogatories
events.description: Defendant Jeffrey Epstein propounded his First Interrogatories to the plaintiff in the civil case.

keyFacts: The document is from a 2008 civil lawsuit (Case No. 08-CV-80811) in the Southern District of Florida where Jeffrey Epstein is the defendant.
Interrogatories posed to the plaintiff ask for a detailed list of all employers and sources of income over the past 10 years (1998-2009).
Interrogatories ask the plaintiff to list all males (excluding Epstein) with whom she had sexual activity since age 10, including dates, nature of activity, and whether money was exchanged.
Interrogatories also ask the plaintiff to list all males (excluding claims against Epstein) whom she has claimed committed sexual assault or battery since age 10.
The plaintiff's legal team includes attorneys Jack A. Goldberger, Bruce E. Reinhart, and Robert Critton.
